@description.name: @description
@description.body: The part loader knows about all generated packages and parts. It contains functionality to load parts and to retrieve part instances.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a parts was loaded. The data of the event instance point to the loaded part instance.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired if a part could not be loaded. The event's {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} method returns the name of the failed part.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Loads one or more parts asynchronously. The callback is called after all parts and their dependencies are fully loaded. If the parts are already loaded the callback is called immediately.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
partNames {String[]} List of parts names to load as defined in the
    config file at compile time.
@param.description:
List of parts names to load as defined in the
    config file at compile time.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
callback {Function} Function to execute on completion.
   The function has one parameter which is an array of ready states of
   the parts specified in the partNames argument.
@param.description:
Function to execute on completion.
   The function has one parameter which is an array of ready states of
   the parts specified in the partNames argument.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object?window} Context to execute the given function in
@param.description: Context to execute the given function in

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Loads one or more parts asynchronously. The callback is called after all parts and their dependencies are fully loaded. If the parts are already loaded the callback is called immediately.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
partNames {String|String[]} List of parts names to load as defined
    in the config file at compile time. The method also accepts a single
    string as parameter to only load one part.
@param.description:
List of parts names to load as defined
    in the config file at compile time. The method also accepts a single
    string as parameter to only load one part.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: callback {Function} Function to execute on completion

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object?window} Context to execute the given function in
@param.description: Context to execute the given function in

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the part instance of the part with the given name.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
name {String} Name of the part as defined in the config file at
    compile time.
@param.description:
Name of the part as defined in the config file at
    compile time.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if a part with the given name is available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
name {String} Name of the part as defined in the config file at
    compile time.
@param.description:
Name of the part as defined in the config file at
    compile time.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a map of all known parts.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
